intro: Cordyla madagascariensis subsp. madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar cordyla, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
